# atlassian_team (Resource)

Team resource for managing Atlassian teams using the Atlassian Teams API.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "atlassian_team" "dev_team" {
  display_name = "Development Team"
  description  = "Our main development team"
  team_type    = "OPEN"
  site_id      = "your-site-id"  # Optional
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `display_name` (String) Team display name
- `description` (String) Team description
- `team_type` (String) Team type (OPEN or CLOSED)

### Optional

- `site_id` (String) Site identifier

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Team identifier (teamId)
- `organization_id` (String) Organization identifier
- `creator_id` (String) ID of the user who created the team
- `state` (String) Team state (ACTIVE, ARCHIVED, etc.)
- `members` (Set) Team members returned by the API
  - `account_id` (String) Account ID of the team member

## Import

Teams can be imported using their team ID:

```shell
terraform import atlassian_team.example team-id-here
```

## Notes

- This resource requires an Atlassian Admin API token, not a regular Jira/Confluence API token
- The requesting user is automatically added as the initial team member
- Team members are read-only and returned by the API but cannot be managed through this resource
